page.title: 03GREAT HENNY
page.content: THIS IS A SCATTERED VILLAGE OF JUST OVER 1000 ACRES ALMOST ENTIRELY AGRICULTURAL IN CHARACTER AND SCENICALLY VERY ATTRACTIVE.SAMANTHA (10) WHO LIVES THERE SAYS IT IS QUIET & SHE LIKES TO HEAR THE BIRDS WHEN SHE WAKES UP.THE TOWER OF THE CHURCH IS A PROMINENT LANDMARK SITED ON A HIGH RIDGE(THE PROBABLE MEANING OF 'HENNY').NAMES LIKE CLAY HILL AND FENN FARM ARE DESCRIPTIVE.THE POPULATION HAS DROPPED FROM 427 IN 1851 TO 136 IN 1981. THE MUSHROOM FARM SENDS ITS PRODUCE TO A WHOLESALER & SPITALFIELDS.IT EMPLOYS 10.THE MUSHROOMS GROW ON A MIX OF HORSE MANURE & STRAW.THE SPENT COMPOST IS SOLD TO GARDENERS.THE LOWER SECTION OF THE VILLAGE CALLED HENNY STREET NEAR THE STOUR IS DESCRIBED SEPARATELY.
